intro: Nitrosalsola laricina, commonly known as the Arctic sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. It thrives in harsh, cold environments and is often found in coastal tundra and rocky areas. Nitrosalsola laricina plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing food for local wildlife in its native habitat.
